intro: Arabis retrofracta, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found growing in rocky or calcareous soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a rough texture and a distinctive mustard-like odor. Arabis retrofracta is typically perennial and thrives in well-drained, sunny environments.
